Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, but avoid room 216.”
Reviews.Author: Frimeur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very conveniently located in the Mitte section of Berlin. It is about 100 meters from the airport bus, which is only a 30-minute ride from TXL. (This will probably be less of an advantage when the new airport opens; I don't know if the location will be as convenient then.) It's about 150 meters from the Hackesher Markt and the S-bahn station of the same name. It's about equally distant on foot from the Brandenburg Gate via Unter den Linden and from the heart of Prenzlauerberg. It's very close to Museum Island and Humboldt University; also the the Alexanderplatz, though not as close as the name would have you think, and in any case the Alexanderplatz should be avoided if possible. The hotel is on the site of a former deportation center (to the concentration camps) which is very movingly commemorated. I give the management a lot of credit for this. The hotel itself is excellent. My single room was very modern and comfortable. I didn't use the hotel breakfast. For ten euros it's probably worthwhile, but there are lots of coffee houses and bakeries within 150 meters, and I preferred to walk about in the morning. Internet access in the rooms was costly - which never seems justified to me - but it was available in the lobby without charge. It was OK for me, but it's something you might consider. There's a sauna and limited exercise room available, which I didn't use. The hotel staff were extremely helpful in every way possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy and modern”
Reviews.Author: HellasAriadni
Reviews.Content: I loved my room. It was very quiet, comfortable, simple and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located, stylish and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annaok
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin after spending the New Years Eve weekend in the City - a great couple of days away with friends. The hotel was an excellent choice. Really well located, just a few minutes walk to the bars and restaurants in hackescher markt, and a 20 minute stroll to Brandenberg Gate. Close to all the attractions but tucked away from the noise of a bustling city. The room was very comfortable, if a bit on the small side although I think this was the luck of the draw as the friends we went with got quite a spacious room. The shower was brilliant, the room clean and the beds very comfortable. Staff were helpful without being intrusive. We were allowed to extend our check out time on the last day as we had a late flight at no extra charge. We had room service breakfast on the last day and that was of excellent quality - a great selection of pastries, cooked breakfast, juices, fruits, cold cuts and cheeses with very generous portions. The only negatives really was that the room was oppressively hot. We had to open all the windows to get a decent nights sleep and this was in late December! The weather outside was unseasonably mild yet the heating was turned up so high, you would think that we were experiencing sub zero temperatures. We also paid a premium rate due to the time of year and felt that it was a little over priced. All in all however, I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, comfort, food and staff. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: bgosma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located, close to the regional train stop (and thus, to the airport) and to a lot of Belin's attraction. Two minutes away from Unter den Linden, the cathedral and museum island, and just a nice 20 minute walk away from the Brandenburg Gate. The hotel itself is very modern and comfortable. The room was big, with a nice bathroom. The hotel faces a quiet street, which is also a plus. The breakfast was excellent. Wifi was available although not included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break in Berlin, Alexander Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamsPig
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Berlin for a family birthday weekend - for my daughters 30th birthday. We wanted to find a well positioned hotel with good access to the sites and public transport and after a lot of research on Trip Advisor we settled on the Alexander Plaza. We weren't disappointed. We had three very nice modern rooms with all the ameneties you would expect. We did have a problem with the water supply to our room but were moved to another room when the issue couldn't be resolved and given some champagne for the inconvenience. The hote was close to the vbus route from the airport, trams and rail links plus walking distance to a lot of the major tourist locations. Breakfast was very good and the staff very helpful - especially setting up a table each morning for the six of us. Overall a very good location for a visit to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CPickus
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with the most perfect location. Room are terrific, very clean and comfortable. Nice bar, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would return again”
Reviews.Author: elainemcgeachy
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin with my sister and my mother for a city break weekend in April and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. Getting to the hotel is simple enough using the airport express train for 3 euros and it takes you straight to Alexander Platz, it is then only a short walk to the hotel or you could exchange on to Hakescher Market which is just round the corner from the hotel. Great for exploring the city. The area has some lovely outdoor eateries, bakeries, bars, restaurants, shops and galleries, mostly reasonably priced. The walking tours of the city start from Hakescher market also. We did the open top bus tour and there are stops nearby. Some of the main sights are easy to walk to such as the TV tower and brandenburg gate. The rooms were quite spacious and the beds very comfy. It was very clean and well appointed. The hotel although closeby to attractions was very quiet and the staff were very helpful. We did not eat in the hotel as we sampled the nearby restaurants and bakeries. The weather was very pleasant on our trip and we loved the city, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for slippery showers!”
Reviews.Author: sjpowellca
Reviews.Content: My family from California stayed here for my nephew's wedding. My brother and I shared a room, and my mother and sister shared another room across the hall. The hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable, for the most part (nice down comforters on the beds). Big caution: the hotel shower/bath floors are very slippery, and there are no skid marks to prevent falls. The hotel also does not provide rubber bath mats unless asked. My elderly mother, who is still limber (she walks a lot and goes to the gym in the U.S.), fell during her second night in the hotel, because the tub was so slippery. When I showered in my room, I had also noticed the slippery tub surface. My mom hit her head very hard, and also her elbow and side. This was about 11 pm at night (my mother showers before bed). We called the night manager and they were slow in calling the doctor (saying it would take him 1-2 hours to show up). About 20 minutes after requesting the doctor, we called the manager to request extra pillows so my now-dizzy mother could sit up in bed while in extreme pain. Maybe 15 minutes later, the night manager came up with the extra pillows, but he had still not called the doctor. Finally, about midnight, the doctor was reached on the phone. Luckily, after my brother received advice on the phone from the doctor, my mother was eventually able to reduce the throbbing pain in her head (where a large bump had arisen) with ibuprofen, and was able to sleep. She did not have to miss the wedding the next day, though was in pain. My alert mother had the presence of mind to turn her head away from her face when she fell, otherwise, she might have had a worse injury. Had she fallen even harder (easy to do in these showers), she could have had very serious or fatal accident. In the morning, the hotel brought up a bath mat and hung it on the door outside my mother and sister's room. These items are not standard in bathrooms. If you stay in the Hotel Alexander Plaza, be sure you ask them for a bath mat before you shower or bath in your room, and exercise extreme caution in the small bathrooms (which have odd angles with the "trendy" modern design). I would also encourage guests to tell the management to put skid marks on the shower/bath surfaces. If more people do this, they might get the message.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks it is!”
Reviews.Author: glennaberdeen_8
Reviews.Content: Our stay(for five nights)got off to an horrendous start as,when we tried to check in,they had no idea of our booking due to incompetence by the booking agency in the UK.There being a film festival in Berlin that week we were informed that they would be unable to accomodate us for the five nights and this would be the same for Berlin as a whole.To cut a long story short we managed to get a room in the end at exorbitant rates.I would like to say that the head receptionist couldn't have been more helpful after all the booking error was not their fault and they are running a business(supply and demand). The room was very spacious and spotless but oh that air-con!!!The room was roasting!!!Also there is no bath-tub(which we knew about before we arrived)but when you end up paying three times the amount you paid for in the uk it is quite a negative. As in other reviews you cannot get a better location to see the main sights of Berlin none of which we found to be more than an half hour's stroll away.Let me tell you that the best thing we did was to go on "the Insider Walking tour which takes four hours and you dont need to book just turn up at one ther two starting points-ours was outside a coffee shop at Hackescher Markt.five minutes walk from the Alexander!!Our guide was an Aussie called Penelope(call me Pen)who had extensive knowledge and made everything very intersesting(her mannerisms reminded me of the dark haired lady who does the "Hotel Inspector"on tv.Also,if you sign up for another other of their trips you get a discount-we did but that's another story!!Suffice to say its the best 12 euro you'll spend in Berlin. To find a great selection of restaurants within strolling distance leave the hotel and head for Hackescher Markt,turn left on Oranienburger st.Let me recommend one-"Oranium"-god tasty food ,impeccable service and very reasonably priced. My review may seem a bit harsh for the Alexander Plaza but the issue with the air-con was a huge negative(I dread to think what it would be like in summer).Lastly,just let me say that Berlin was terrific-Good food,Great public transport and historically,one of the most interesting places you'll ever visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.Central. modern, warm and spotlessly clean room.”
Reviews.Author: CandK0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel before Christmas, 2010. The weather was -14degrees outside so it was a pleasure to arrive back to a very warm,quiet and comfortable room. breakfast each morning was in very pleasant surroundings as we watched the waitress meticulously set the dining tables around us. There was a great selection of food available, down to a variety of health food seeds for cereals! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet central to Unter den Linden and around the corner from the S- bhan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craigmaroinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 30Dec - 3Jan for New Year. On arrival were told given non-smoking room although had requested smoking. We were told there were no smoking rooms left. We accepted this and did not make a fuss. However the reception staff tried without our knowledge to change the room to smoking and succeeded. So right from the start were impressed with this hotel. The buffet breakfast was excellent and again so were the staff. Room was very modern and clean and we could not fault it. The hotel was situated close to all the transport systems and we travelled extensively on the excellent Berlin system (purchaed Welcome Card) Had a great time watching fireworks at midnight in Alexanderplatz. Have been to Brandenburg Gate previous year and tfound Alexanderplatz much better. Could not find anything wrong with this hotel and would recomment if to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clever option in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMetzker
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Alexander Plaza and it overcame my expectations: excellent location, great and healthy breakfast, gentle staff. The only problems were the pillow (that can't be called "a pillow") and the bathroom (after taking a shower, the entire bathroom was soaked!).

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, value for money”
Reviews.Author: aman_imp
Reviews.Content: A great, awesome & cozy place, closely located to most of the sightseeing places in Berlin. Proximity to public transport and good restaurants. Food options served, even for south east asian visitors are really good. I would surely like to stay again during my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A very well-run hotel in the heart of the former East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: defBerlin_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: The Alexander Plaza is a located in the very heart of what used to be East Berlin, just a few hundred meters from Alexanderplatz, Museumsinsel, and Hackescher Markt, one of the new Berlin tourist hotspots, respectively, and abot 100 of the S-Bahn (inner city railway) station "Hackescher Markt". The immediate neighbourhood has been under construction recently, and during our repeated stays there during the summer, we have on one occassion had a room opposite to the construction site - however the windows were completely sound-proof and the air conditioning excellent, so no complaints there... . (Work on the construction site seems now to be completed or near-completed.) The rooms have been renovated over the course of the last year, although they looked still fairly new in the old design. Apparently, the renovation was made for reasons of style only (the main colours changed from orange and turqoise to red and grey, which was a welcome change). All rooms we have stayed at so far have left nothing to be desired in terms of equipment and maintenace. The beds are very comfortable, the furniture is of high quality and has in large parts been especially designed for the hotel to match the interior design - characteristically, none of the rooms offers a similar ground-plan, and all deviate slightly from the rectangular norm, which is very appealing. All rooms are very quiet (sound proof doors and windows). The bathrooms are relatively small, but well-equipped (including hairdryers). The breakfast is served in a nice winter garden. It offers a decent variety, but could be more original given the relatively high price. However, you can order as much espresso capuccino, latte etc. to go with your breakfast as you wish - not just the standard coffee usually included in the bill. Service is friendly and professional, and the hotel has a warm and family-like atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,rooms, breakfast--exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: stuball12
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Stayed in a double with sofabed with our teen son and he was very comfortable. Suite had full bathroom and additional wc so easy for three guests. Room was huge and nice modern decor. Desk staff helpful. Close to transport (buses, subway, trains) but also walkable to most sights. Very close to musuem island and a nice area (Hacksher Mkt) two blocks away with many outdoor restaurants and cafes. Breakfast was 12 euros but quite extensive in a pretty atrium room. HIghly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good recently renovated hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HelTraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just a day before arrival because we realized that the hotel we had booked didn't have A/C. Weather forecast said it'll be +35C and so it was so A/C was a must. Due to last minute deal we got this hotel half price so it really was worth it. Air condition was powerful enough and a saviour of our 5 day holiday. Location of the hotel was perfect. TXL airport bus runs 50 meters from it, so did trams and (sky)train. Museum island was 2 minute walk away. There was a construction camp next tto the hotel, but we asked room from inner yard and had no problems with noise. Room was recently renovated, spacious and had big wardrobe with lots of hangers. It had big free safety box, There was 250 euro fine if one smokes in non-smoking room! There were no double beds available but twins were put together and they were hard enough to get a good night sleeps. Bathroom was good and had nice shower with good water pressure. Shower curtain was lousy though. Breakfast was perfect including everything one could possible think of eating and more. One pisses me of. You know when the hotels advertise they greenness by by placing these notes in bathroom: "It's your choice - towel on the rackj I'll use it again, towel on the floor: I'd like new ones". I could easily use towel for few days but they change it every day! Very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: jsbach200
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in the week between Xmas and New Year, as written in other reports there was a building being renovated across the street from the hotel but luckily for us there was no work being done whilst we stayed in the hotel. Breakfast was not included in our room rate and at €17 per person it seemed a little expensive so we went to local bakers, of which there were many for a cheaper option. Around the hotel there were many restaurants and bars, all reasonably priced. The S-Bahn is 2 minutes walk away and tye main east-west highway through Berlin was 80 metres away, with a bus stop at the end of the street. Go again-Yes definitely.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with airy rooms and an excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dolwerdd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near a train station and conveniently located for other attractions. The standard room we booked was excellent, with a high ceiling and very large window. It was simply a very pleasant room. The breakfast was excellent. I had my bacon and eggs, whilst my wife and daughter had the more healthy options they prefer. It was all good quality. I should mention that the breakfast was included in our price. I would be more than happy to return to this hotel on another Berlin visit.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure building work is finished before you book!”
Reviews.Author: mikkifr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellently located near Alexanderplatz and a good base for sightseeing. Room was clean, but small. Bed was comfortable and shower good. Wifi was expensive to use. Our room was directly opposite a building site, which was noisy from early morning until early evening, including Saturday. Probably fine if you are staying here on business and plan to be up early. We did ask if we could change but were told that the hotel was fully booked, otherwise staff were helpful and spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTraveldiva
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here, and thankfully no more. Noisy room - not noise from the street but from the hallway. It's a good place if you just want a place to lay your head at night and in a very good location for seeing museums and sights. Room was small, though beds comfortable. Shower was smallest I have seen since being in Venice a few years ago. Comfortable climate control. They do have wi-fi but you have to pay. Restaurant in lobby was good.

Reviews.Title: “easy and cozy!!”
Reviews.Author: demi78
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms with interesting view.This hotel is really close to everything you want to see in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Eastcoast Approves!”
Reviews.Author: ecoastman
Reviews.Content: All rankings are out of ten (10 being the best). Town charm reflects the overall tourist appeal of the city since we enjoy walking the streets, visiting shops and sitting on street cafes. It does not reflect the number of activities or size of the city which is indicated by the Recommended # days. The hotel was very clean and had very good service (9/10) BERLIN Charm = 8 Recommended #days = 2-4 Hotel Alexander Plaza Quality = 8.5 (We got a huge room with high ceilings) Location = 8 (Close to the lively Hackescher Markt district. Quiet street except for daytime building construction across the street) Breakfast = NA (+ 17 Euros. We just went out for a smaller breakfast since we were getting tired of huge buffet breakfasts everyday!)

Reviews.Title: “The Alezander Plaza is the Hotel to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: pet75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexander Plaza for the second time and i was even more happy than the first time i was there. Perfect location, clean hotel, good service, good breakfast, comfortable fitness center. If you go to Berlin you have to go to Berlin East and the Alexander Plaza is the place to stay in MItte! If back to Berlin i will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good service at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: etravelcho
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a business trip from Berlin. I stayed at this hotel with other colleagues for 5 nights. Upon arrival, I was shown up to a big room by one of the reception staff. The room was on the fourth floor overlooking the railway/tram lines and a building site - quiet though with the help of the windows and the people at the construction site did stick to their "German working hours". There were good choices for breakfast and I was asked every morning whether I wanted eggs done specially - they did it to all guests which I thought was excellent. One of my colleagues forgot her hair brush and the hotel staff actually went out and bought her one and put it in her room - that's what I call service! Over the railway line/station is an area full of restaurants, cafe, shops, nice little courtyards - great place to eat out and must be wonderful in the summer. Museums and official buildings are within walking distance and I shall definitely return in the future with my family for a city break. We could then use the sauna at the basement which I did not have time to do so this time.

Reviews.Title: “Need to be more consumer friendly”
Reviews.Author: bhutan02
Reviews.Content: Checked into Alexander Plaza on a Friday afternoon for two nights. Was told that my prepaid room was on the 6th floor and, due to construction, the elevator only went to 5th floor. I'd have to schlep my bags (and myself) up and down the stairs everytime I wanted to go in or out. What an unpleasant surprise! They didn't even offer to have someone carry my suitcases up the stairs. When I mentioned my knee surgery (cane was the tip-off), they made a big show of reluctantly upgarding me to a double on another floor. Tiny room (upgraded!) that looked out on a small interior space--had to keep curtains drawn at all times to prevent office workers across the airspace from looking in. Recently renovated hotel is in a great location for walking to museums and shopping in an interesting gentrifying section of "East" Berlin. Wait staff at the bar was very pleasant. With all lights on, the room was dark; poor lighting except next to the bed; tiny bath with 30x30-inch shower; only one towel until I asked for another; 17 Euro breakfast that was just okay in content; "Business Center" that was closed of the weekend at 4p on Friday.

Reviews.Title: “perfect value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: good hotel located at alexander platz like 15 minutes by taxi to shopping areas clean midsize room ,mine was a single with little strange configuration in the hotel corner everything correct hotel with modern decor good breakfast buffet included in rate perfect for business with a lot of restaurants around go for the italian left hand size of square coming from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tom016
Reviews.Content: Well located and nice rooms but too noisy!!! they organise private parties on the seventh floor of the hotel, so it is impossible to sleep on the fith and sixth floor unitl 3 am in the morning!! be careful with this fact!! it ruined our holiday in Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull with th Minibar charges”
Reviews.Author: NunoLisbon_Portugal
Reviews.Content: It's a good and well located hotel. Nice rooms, spacious and confortable, the only problem is the TV location (on the right side of the bed) that makes very dificult to wach TV from the bed. Fair breackfast, and good service. The problem with me, was the charge of the Minibar. I didn't take ANYTHING from the Minibar and they make me to pay a water a beer and a chocolate. Of course i have told them that i didn't take anything, but it was my word against the housekeeper word. As Minibar do not need any signature...the housekeeper word as win. It is not for the 9.00 € that i have paid, but, for me it was a fraude. So, you just have to watch carefull about this...the rest its a good and well located hotel (with a underground-S station called "Hackescher Markt" at 100 meters )

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: dflo
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel located in the Mitte neighborhood of Berlin - incredibly convenient to the Museum Island, Alexander Platz and all public transportation. The S-Bahn stop Hackescher Markt is a stones throw from the hotel entrance and happens to be the site of a nice plaza filled with cafes and bars with ourdoor seating - the whole place was filled with people drinking and hanging out in the evenings. We were able to walk to great dining spots (i.e. places on the Oranienburger Strasse) in 15-20 minutes. *Our only beef with this place is that the cleaning person (we assume) failed to properly lock the door at one point and we returned in the late afternoon to find our door wide open! Nothing was missing and the staff handled it professionally - probably doesn't happen all the time but wanted to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, stylish choice”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid75
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night on a business trip to Berlin, but would definitely stay again if I return to Berlin for a holiday. Very large and comfortable room and very stylish decor throughout the hotel. I was particularly impressed by the modern art in the lobby and corridors. I had no difficulty getting a non-smoking room when I booked via email only a few days before the trip. Very quiet in spite of the very central location. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: Netrom
Reviews.Content: According to staff, this hotel has three floors of non-smoking rooms. I requested such a room 6 weeks prior to arrival. But when I arrived, the hotel was fully booked, and a non-smoking room had not been held for me. I asked the staff whether this was a single mistake, but the reply was no. The hotel does not have an IT system nor manual processes that allow them to allocate smoking and non-smoking rooms according to reservations when the hotel is full. So my conclusion is that this hotel cannot be recommended to non-smokers. Apart from this - and the extremely overpriced internet connection - this is an OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's SoHo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights and enjoyed the spacious and spotless very bright rooms, modern steam and sauna area with cold plunge, and complete breakfast buffet. The staff was helpful and their food recommendations in the immediate vicinity were right on the mark.Active bar in the evening. Excellent location. Would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !!”
Reviews.Author: Joey073
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in this hotel and was very pleased. The location is great and very handy to the S-bahn train. I thought the train noise was going to be a problem, but the windows insulate the sound very well. The hotel staff is great and was very very helpful in every aspect. The only negative issue could be the 15E breakfast, it is expensive but the breakfast spread is great with any kind of breakfast food you could want. There is also much to see and do in the immediate vicinity, Alexander Platz is just across the street. I would highly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 18April2005
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Berlin, and having this hotel as our base for three nights worked out so well for us. Just as described here, it is on a quiet side street, but it's only a few hundred yards to the cafes and bars of the Hackischer Markt which we loved, and very close to the river and the Museum Island in the other direction. We thought we'd be using a lot of public transport, but everything is a lot more compact than we expected, and we went everywhere on foot. We booked way back in March, so I half-expected them to have never heard of us, but checking in went very smoothly, and they even upgraded us to a bigger room than we had originally booked. It had all we needed and we were very comfortable indeed. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, just a couple of drinks in the bar on our first evening. Everyone was very friendly and efficient. Really couldn't fault the place at all - ten out of ten. We are already talking about going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Space!”
Reviews.Author: Katzen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for (sadly) only one night on the way back from Krakow. The room was more of an apartment in size and amenities. It was clean and beautifully designed with huge airy windows, wooden floor and high ceiling. There was an attractive sitting area to lounge about in and a king sized bed with crisp white cotton bedding. There was a simple kitchenette, modern bathroom and separate extra toilet. A classy, cool and elegant room in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulrsWellington_NZ
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms. Excellent breakfast. Handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Alexander conquers?”
Reviews.Author: MrWhippy98
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to the sights but off the main drag. We stayed for 3 nights and booked way in advance, but we ended up with the smallest room on the floor! Room was well appointed being newly done but lacked more than one pillow! With great views over the train station. The window insulation made for a very quiet room. Don't have the hotel breakfast, which is very nice but very expensive at 15 Euros. Much better to go across to the station market and take your choice of cafes eating an excellent breakfast outside at less than half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the eastside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We saw the recommendation in the Lonley Planet guide and we just dropped-in on a friday night. They gave us the suite for the price of the double room! The hotel had a very nice interior. Excellent breakfast in quiet surroundings. They even had bikes. It was much more fascinating to live in the old east sector than in the west, especially because of the extensive renovation. Not so expensive neighbourhood restaurants. The hotel restaurant was not very exciting. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service at the Alexandra Hotel was rude and slow especially on reception. When I sat in the cocktail lounge for a drink, I had to wait for ages to be served (along with several other tables). The staff tend to be young and inexperienced. The single room I had was very small with a sloping roof and despite only having a small single bed, there wasn't even room for for a desk. None of the special touches I am used to a hotel of this rating (I had to ask for toiletries because I had forgotton my shampoo but this is something I normally don't need to concern myself with in a 4 star hotel). No clock radio was provided which meant you had to rely on the facilities provided with the TV but all the instructions for the audio/video equipment are in German and no-one gave me the wakeup call I asked for. The hotel is understaffed and staff's knowledge of English isn't good. All in all a very big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked at this hotle over a month in advance. Upon arrival was informed that our room was unavailable - 'there was a problem'. We were transferred to another hotel having been told that there has been an issue with their computer (and that 25 other people were also affected). Substitute hotel was poorly located for us and, as a consequence, our first break to Berlin was ruined. Staff at the Alex Plaza were unhelpful and had a 'couldn't care less' attitude. We got the strong impression that 'tourists' were very much secondary to 'business' guests. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: si469
Reviews.Content: Situated near the enormous TV mast (tallest structure in Europe), you always know how far you are away from the hotel. Excellent location in the the heart of the old East sector (which architecturally & culturally far outweighs the boring West), this is a great place to stay. Clean, comfortable, great breakfast, good value. If you're a tourist, take the hop-on, hop-off guided bus tour - its fabulous (you can get on just around the corner). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDrummer
Reviews.Content: great location, clean, quiet, friendly, and great comp breakfasts. i'll stay again for business.

Reviews.Title: “very good, both for busness and leisure travel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: rooms good, big, modern. delicious breakfast. top location near hackescher markt, muesumsinsel and sightseeingbuses

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: ldw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites in mid-April. Perfect location in center of Old Berlin. Large well-appointed rooms, especially deluxe executive #506. Particularly enjoyed proximity to outstanding, hip and inexpensive restaurants and bars -- all within a three minute walk. Museum Island a short stroll; easy public transit a few steps from the door. Can't imagine a better place from which to explore all of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Centraly Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elleboogie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprise for us as thier website did not do them justice. The hotel is modern with a beautiful lobby that opens unto a very nice restaurant that has outdoor seating. The delicious breakfast is served in the atrium set in an enclosed courtyard. The AP is within walking distance from Alexanderplatz and the historic district of Hackescher Höfe. Our hotel room looked directly across at the Hackescher Markt, with its many outdoor restaurants as well as shops, bars and nightclubs. One block from the tram and subway, it is an ideal location to explore Berlin.
